definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Some people made ink rubbings of their loved ones’ names, often on the official event program.
sentences.chinese: 許多人將至親的名字拓印下來。

sentences.english: Could you still find your family and your old house?
sentences.chinese: 試問還能否找到至親和老屋？

sentences.english: Chinese most tell very close relative to affection, the effect that suffers the state " with formal " comes deep.
sentences.chinese: 中國人最講至親至情，受“禮儀之邦”的影響至深。

sentences.english: The kite is my dearest parents.
sentences.chinese: 放風箏的人便是我至親至愛的雙親。

sentences.english: He HAS stuffed the managerial staff with personal associates.
sentences.chinese: 他在管理人員中安置了許多至親好友。

sentences.english: Passive smoke kills your dearest ones first.
sentences.chinese: 被動吸菸首先危害你至親的人。

sentences.english: He told me that his aunt was his only immediate relative.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我說姑母是他唯一的至親。

sentences.english: Many have lost close male relatives.
sentences.chinese: 許多人失去了至親的男性親屬。

sentences.english: Only a select few have gave been invited to the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮只邀請了幾個至親好友參加。

sentences.english: As soon as the unknown relative's decision was known Boaz spoke up.
sentences.chinese: 當那位至親作出決定之後，便輪到波阿斯發言。

definition: affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to worry about/to be concerned about
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
